interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Young Stranger
Review Date: 2018/09/28
Store: James Mac Arthur, Kim Hunter, James Daly, James Gregory, Jeffrey Silver, Whit Bissell  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
Product Description: ["Before he gained his fame directing cinematic masterpieces like The Manchurian Candidate and Seven Days in May, John Frankenheimer made his feature film debut with this sensitive father-son drama about troubled youth. When clean-cut Hal Ditmar (Hawaii Five-O's James MacArthur), son of a wealthy movie producer (James Daly), gets into a fight with a movie theater manager (Whit Bissell) no one believes he acted in self-defense. With the police concerned that they have another juvenile delinquent on their hands, Hal's mother (Kim Hunter) thinks the problem lies in the growing gulf between father and son. Heartfelt and effective, Frankenheimer's already sure hand at the helm and the talent that star MacArthur shared with his illustrious mother Helen Hayes buoy The Young Stranger above the common ground of 1950's delinquency dramas."]
Average Rating: 4.0
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': 'James Mac Arthur, Kim Hunter, James Daly, James Gregory, Jeffrey Silver, Whit Bissell', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 24 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.12 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 24 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 16, 2012', 'Actors': 'James Mac Arthur, Kim Hunter, James Daly, James Gregory, Jeffrey Silver, Whit Bissell', 'Studio': 'Warner Archive', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}

Spencer's Mountain (DVD)
Maureen O'Hara  (Actor),     Henry Fonda  (Actor),     Delmer Daves  (Director, Producer, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Kids & Family
['Product Description', "Spencer's Mountain (DVD)", 'Academy Award winner Henry Fonda stars with Maureen O\'Hara as thepatriarch of a rural West Virginia family, a family that lives andstrives for a better life on the slopes of Spencer\'s Mountain.ClaySpencer (Fonda--On Golden Pond, 12 Angry Men) and his wife, Olivia(O\'Hara--The Parent Trap), have worked hard to rear their nine children.And they are filled with pride when their eldest son, Clayboy (JamesMacArthur--Swiss Family Robinson, "Hawaii Five-O"), graduates from highschool at the head of his class and dreams of being the first Spencer togo to college. But, even though Clay is the best employee at the localmill, there isn\'t enough money to pay for Clayboy\'s tuition at theuniversity. Now, the entire family will work hard, suffer and sacrificehopes to help the Clayboy live his dream in this classic family film.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Long before Henry Fonda played an irascible patriarch in', 'On Golden Pond', ', he played an equally crusty family man in this warmly rustic, 1963 drama', "Spencer's Mountain", ', based on an Earl Hamner Jr. novel that later inspired the television series', 'The Waltons', '. Fonda plays Clay Spencer, a fiercely independent, hard-drinking, foul-mouthed Wyoming laborer who believes in God but rejects (to his tiny community\'s consternation) organized religion. Scraping together enough money to build a new house for his wife (Maureen O\'Hara) and nine children, Spencer runs into an obstacle to both his plans and family pride when his college-bound son (James MacArthur) romances the daughter of Spencer\'s boss. Director Delmer Daves whips up a kind of morose schmaltz out of the earnest material, but it\'s Fonda\'s grit and heartland integrity that carry the day and establish some self-effacing wit. Some nice features here, including interviews with Fonda and a short documentary, "Spencer\'s Mountain: Grand Teton Premiere."', '--Tom Keogh']

['Special edition 8 DVD Set. One of the longest running and most popular of all the television westerns, Wagon Train topped the ratings for eight seasons in the late 1950s and 1960s. These 32 color episodes of the 7th season are fully restored from their original NBC Universal masters by TMG, which is proud to present them on DVD.']

Pineapple Express / Superbad / Youth in Revolt (2010) / Year One
Seth Rogen  (Actor),     James Franco  (Actor)    Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
['Pineapple Express (2008)', "Stoner Dale Denton's (Seth Rogen) enjoyment of a rare strain of marijuana may prove fatal when he drops his roach in a panic after witnessing a murder. Upon learning that the fancy weed can be traced back to them, Dale and his dealer (James Franco) go on the lam, with a dangerous drug lord (Gary Cole) and crooked cop (Rosie Perez) hot on their heels.", 'Superbad (2007)', 'Two inseparable best friends navigate the last weeks of high school and are invited to a gigantic house party. Together with their nerdy friend, they spend a long day trying to score enough alcohol to supply the party and inebriate two girls in order to kick-start their sex lives before they go off to college. Their quest is complicated after one of them falls in with two inept cops who are determined to show him a good time.', 'Year One (2009)', 'After Neanderthal hunter Zed (Jack Black) is exiled for eating forbidden fruit, he and his sardonic buddy Oh (Michael Cera) leave their village and begin an epic journey through history. The pals encounter biblical characters such as Cain (David Cross) and Abel, Abraham (Hank Azaria), and others, and wind up in Sodom. Along the way, Zed debunks commonly held beliefs and replaces them with his own delusions of grandeur.', 'Youth in Revolt (2009)', "As a fan of Albert Camus and Jean-Luc Godard, teenage Nick Twisp (Michael Cera) is definitely out of his element when his mother and her boyfriend move the family to a trailer park. When a pretty neighbor named Sheeni (Portia Doubleday) plays records by French crooners, it's love at first sight for frustrated and inexperienced Nick. Learning that she is dating someone, Nick launches a hilarious quest to find his way into Sheeni's heart -- and bed."]

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Rating Trend:** The user maintains an impressive average rating of 4.8, demonstrating consistent satisfaction, although their engagement with newer films has slightly decreased.

- **Nostalgia:** The user exhibits a deep connection to past experiences influencing their viewing habits. Their recent interactions, including purchases of classic dramas, reflect an ongoing appreciation for narratives that explore themes of youth and familial relationships, blending nostalgia with current interests.

- **Content Preferences:** The user's genre interests encompass Westerns, Action, Drama, and Comedies that target youth and adolescents. They continue to seek films that showcase meaningful themes like friendship, personal growth, and relatable adolescent experiences, enhancing their diverse tastes alongside classic Westerns.

- **Director/Producer Recognition:** The user favors established filmmakers and renowned actors, enjoying a bridge between beloved classic films and contemporary works that evoke familiarity.

- **Emotional Connection:** The user values storytelling that elicits nostalgia and heartfelt emotions. Their recent focus on dramas further aligns with their appreciation for narratives that capture the complexities of youth, reinforcing their openness to both classic and modern themes.

Overall, this user thrives on a blend of nostalgic media and contemporary narratives, characterized by quality storytelling, emotional depth, and themes that resonate across generations, creating a seamless fusion of past and present cinematic experiences.
